result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela D Liggans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Fail/Prevent Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(4)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: with credit for 3 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED. Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

Obtain/maintain employment.
Obtain GED or HSED.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim/child and then only with prior approval of agent or the court(Children's Court) or BMCW.
3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
No new law violations.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: THE FIRST 30 DAYS with WORK AND CHILD VISITATION privileges, to report by Noon on 9-21-2015. The balance of 60 days is STAYED for review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela D Liggans

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Angela D Liggans in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.  Any modification of no contact order will be authorized by agent.

Defendant Angela D Liggans in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by all parties.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 26 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 3 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 13 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 13 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS  
Conditions of probation include:
-Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, THE FIRST 30 DAYS with WORK AND CHILD VISITATION privileges, to report by Noon on 9-21-2015. The balance of 60 days is STAYED for review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm
 -Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim/child and then only with prior approval of agent or the court(Children's Court) or BMCW.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation; Sentencing Referreal form; Justicepoint report  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Angela D Liggans in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DUe to jury trial in progress, the court will adjourn sentencing to 9-16-2015.  Parties are in agreement with date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report.

Defendant Angela D Liggans in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Counts 2 & 3 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Case adjourned to branch 38 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant Angela D Liggans in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution. Due to court congestion, matter unable to be heard today. Matter is adjourned for Plea & Sentencing on Jury Trial date. Court VACATED Jury Trial date 7/20/2015 at 8:30, and converted it to a Plea & Sentencing date at 1:30 PM.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angela D Liggans in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Final Pretrial Conference.  Defense counsel requests an adjourned Final Pretrial date prior to the Jury Trial date of 7/20/2015. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial date to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Office Contact.

Defendant Angela D Liggans in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Abbey Marie DeSiato for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angela D Liggans in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to Chief Judge Directive, case reassigned to Judge Grady, branch 23, to follow ADA assigned to case. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court granted. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Darrell K.; CL dob 2/26/00; ML dob 8/5/06; ML dob 1/28/09; CL dob 4/14/05 unless as approved per Children's Court Order of if Children's Court in not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare

Defendant Angela D Liggans in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Angela D Liggans in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
